website_summaries.verdict: A curated feeder that incorporates your cat's favorite food into an engaging experience.
pros: Tests your cat's instincts as he or she must work to eat
Sturdy enough for big cats that like to lounge on available objects
Customers report their cats take instantly to this combined feeder and puzzle
cons: May not hold up to cats that have an appetite for cardboard

customer_reviews.title: It actually works
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical.. however my pictures speak for themselves. My lazy, overweight, senior kitty is pictured with her paws in the box! Do they enjoy trying to solve the puzzle? I'm not sure, but either way it certainly keeps them occupied for a while. Also, I really liked the instructions/insert that came with the box. It had some interesting facts and was very clear on how to assemble. (And assembly was VERY simple.)
customer_reviews.author: Waffles

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: For $15 I thought why not try it, it had got good reviews. Well my cat Homer usually likes the box the toy came in more than the actual toy, but not this time. He really seems to enjoy it and it keeps him entertained and stimulated. This might be his all time favorite plaything. We've had this toy for at least a year and he plays with it several times each, still looks new. Can't wait for the newer version, Catamazing Epic,which I hear will come out next January. It is the best toy he has.
customer_reviews.author: Mjojo6331

customer_reviews.title: The Cat Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat is not a “toy” cat. Most things I’ve bought him get a 2-second glance at best. But he loves this box. I am not sure how long it will last because he pushes and drags it around the living room. He definitely owns it!
customer_reviews.author: LSB

customer_reviews.title: I cant believe I spent money on this! I ...
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe I spent money on this ! I could have cut holes in a shoe box and it would be the same thing. I was the "one born every minute" when I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JERRY KUNZ

customer_reviews.title: save your money
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommended this and I thought it would be a great way to reduce how many treats my cat was eating but after my cat got his head STUCK in the large hole and started running around the room trying to knock the large box off of his head I never wanted to use it again. Also, the oil from the cat treats ruined the card board very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Cardboard
customer_reviews.text: Expensive piece of cardboard with holes in it. My cat loves interactive toys but had no interest in this. He put his head under it and flipped it on his side to get the treats out
customer_reviews.author: J. Merlich

customer_reviews.title: the cats do like it
customer_reviews.text: what can i say. its a cardboard box with holes in it but the cats go bananas. maybe my cats are kind of dumb. but maybe i am kind of dumb. after all i shelled out big money for a cardboard box. maybe we are all kind of dumb. i tried to smoke catnip once, we all did i guess, but i used a paper towel as rolling paper. it didn't get me high, not any more than smoking dried banana peel did.
customer_reviews.author: Boney Mariner

customer_reviews.title: Ver expensive piece of cardboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this expensive piece of cardboard based on the photos and reviews. Frankly, it is a piece of cardboard with holes in it that do not line up. There are no “slits” or tabs to hold it together, and when it is folded into a box, the holes did not line up. I ended up putting this highly overpriced piece of cardboard into my recycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: ChattyPatty

customer_reviews.title: ... 14 yr old siamese and 4yr old ginger both love this. I have to rememebr to keep it ...
customer_reviews.text: My 14 yr old siamese and 4yr old ginger both love this. I have to rememebr to keep it full of treats. I tried to get a pic of the ginger standing on it to show it easily holds 14lbs.
customer_reviews.author: MsFB

customer_reviews.title: Cats are finicky
customer_reviews.text: I know all cats are different and have their own personalities, just like humans so I’m not sure how to rate this item. My cat is 4 years old. He wasn’t interested at all. I gave it to my friend who has a kitten. The kitten wasn’t impressed either.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Kitties have no interest..just frustration!
customer_reviews.text: Chose this toy after reading many good reviews. My cats are easily bored and I was really looking forward to them being entertained and challenged. I expected, at least my male cat, to be interested as he is extremely food and treat motivated. It took me longer to assemble this toy than for them to lose interest and walk away from it. They were not able to get any of the treats out so gave up and never attempted to try again. Unless your cat can “pick up/scoop” things with their paws it would be very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Collins54

customer_reviews.title: BEST & MOST AFFORDABLE CAT TOY/treat dispensary EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: It really is the best. My cat is a food grubber and literally gets frantic to inhale treats and food as fast as possible, so giving him treats in this is way better for him. He will play with it for quiet a while, give up, just to come back to it a few hours later once he's hungry enough to work for some treats:) sorry for my poor camera skills, but I still wanted people to see him playing with it:)
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: All of our cats love this silly box
customer_reviews.text: All of our cats love this silly box. It was easy to put together (and sent in a recyclable and adorable HUGE envelope), and then we dropped in the treats and let them have it. We have 5 cats. They have never all enjoyed one toy before. One cat is 16 - he's the one we are sharing the photo of. He also has a birth defect in his front leg, making him basically a three-legged cat. He still figured out how to get treats from this box. :)
customer_reviews.author: CF6

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Definitely not "Best Cat Toy Ever"
customer_reviews.text: It's cardboard. and it has holes. I agree with my cat that it needs some serious design fixes. First, it helps if you cut some of the holes a bit bigger, or at least so that they go all the way to the bottom. Only one hole is the right size/shape, and it's almost impossible for cats to pull the food out. It works well if you only want to put cat toys inside, though. You also need to tape down the cardboard inserts which don't stay in place. On the plus side, it's recyclable.
customer_reviews.author: MatteoPhx

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy For Every Cat
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this in 2013 for my bengal-mix cat, to engage her brain while giving her treats. This was the cheapest, yet most intricate puzzle box on Amazon, and what cat doesn't love cardboard?? I had to tape half the holes to give my cat a challenge... But she's loved it ever since! I put treats in it every day, and she'll "solve the puzzle" for ping pong balls as well. Recently I noticed the cardboard was tearing, so I just bought her a new one. But hey lasting 4 years with a high-energy cat is pretty good :D
customer_reviews.author: Harp Gal

customer_reviews.title: My kitten loves it
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the toy. I also purchased a squeaking mouse toy from Amazon () and my kitten loves trying to get the mouse out of her Cat Amazing toy. She only managed to get the small treats I'd put in by climbing on top of the box, getting all 4 feet in different holes, falling on her back with the box on top of her, and the treats falling on her head. I give points for creativity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I thought the idea behind this toy was great, but the final product was very disappointing. The cardboard insert to the box doesn't fit flush to the sides of the box, so little treats get stuck in places no cat can get to. Also, the insert I was given doesn't look like the insert in the instructions. I tried taking the insert out and using only the box, but then the treats are too easily extracted. Frustrated, my one cat just started chewing the cardboard which, I guess, is somewhat entertaining for him.
customer_reviews.author: Ger-Ber

customer_reviews.title: My cat disowned me
customer_reviews.text: I can see why some cats would love this toy but Meeko was absolutely appalled at this cardboard labyrinth of treat-withholding. I made the mistake of putting treats in there...he apparently finds it an abhorrent practice to work for treats. He completely refused to make eye contact with me after he couldn't get his treats.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if your cat bites cardboard
customer_reviews.text: Our cat was immediately intrigued by this and spent a good twenty minutes pawing out 8/10 of the treats we put inside. Seemed like an instant win. However, our cat became frustrated with the two treats he couldn't access and so just chewed his way through the cardboard to get at the last two. So this toy lasted two hours in our household. I think we'll take the idea of a foraging toy and get one made out of a sturdier material.
customer_reviews.author: ghostshirt

customer_reviews.title: Cat destroyed by 2nd day.
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings. My cat destroyed this within two days of my purchasing it. But it is a really cool idea that kept him super entertained for a while.... But also it costs $15... But it's constructed really well... But also my house is now covered in pieces of cardboard. Do I regret this purchase? Only a little. Would I ever buy again? Nope. Don't think so. There's a version of this on here that's wood, I think I'll try that next.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Too Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and well made, but too lightweight. My cat seemed frustrated after just a few minutes because even though he can get his paw on the prize inside, the box moves around as he reaches and pulls, making it difficult to pull out what he has found. For about $26, I recommend instead the Trixie Cat Activity board. It’s made from heavyweight plastic so doesn’t move as he’s trying to wiggle out his prize and it doesn’t wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Amy King

customer_reviews.title: Cat loved it but ate it
customer_reviews.text: My cats loved this puzzle feeder. But when they got frustrated, they would try to chew their way into it. A few weeks after getting it for them, one of our cats got very ill - vomiting and diarrhea that lasted for several weeks. We knew something in her environment had changed and systematically checked everything from the foods they were eating to the filters in our a/c unit. Eventually, we landed on the puzzle feeder. Whether it was the cardboard itself, or the inks used to dye it, this was what was making her sick. Maybe ok for cats who don't like to chew/eat everything but not safe otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Innovative, Slow Feeder, Puzzle, EZ Assembly, travels well
customer_reviews.text: This is way more than I expected in many ways, easy to put together, great construction & science behind slow-eating puzzles for cats, it challenges them and makes them work for treats. Keeps my cat busy & entertained while I work, kids love watching cat work on getting snack. I got my cat who uses this flat on ground, another cat visitor will tip it over, hacking the slow feeder. It can be secured to area rug, furniture base, or TV tray, cutting board so cat can’t flip it. It is fun to watch 2 cats working on puzzle together.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Fun but expensive for cardboard.
customer_reviews.text: My six kittens enjoyed this toy for a few weeks but being made of cardboard, the inevitable happened and my lovable thugs began to tear it apart. Good idea but a bit expensive for a cardboard item. If it was made of a more durable material (maybe recycled plastic), it would last a lot longer and be worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mollydogbiscuits

customer_reviews.title: Durable, entertaining, and one happy cat dad.
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually really surprised at how great this works. My cats have destroyed cardboard boxes in the past, and generally get bored of toys quickly (cause you know, they're cats). I'm actually pretty surprised at 1) how long this has kept there attention and preoccupied while trying to solve the puzzles. 2) how durable this is, it's still holding strong after a few months of use. So needless to say, it's pretty easy. Make sure to look up their installation video on youtube to avoid any mistakes in assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Nico S. Montanari

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I love the simplicity and concept of this toy. Often, I find my cat getting bored because it seems as though he figures out a lot of toys fairly quickly. I wanted a puzzle for him to solve in order to make his treats more satisfying. It's adorable to watch him move his paws around and peek his little eyes into the box to get the treat out. My cat enjoys it a lot! I would love to get another version again.
customer_reviews.author: booKLover

customer_reviews.title: Smart cats only (unless you're sadistic)
customer_reviews.text: I have one big, fluffy chonk (13 yrs.) who loves this and a skinny, younger doofus (8 yrs.) who can't quite figure it out. I expected this going into it because I already knew there was an intelligence gap, but I had hoped the slow one could learn...She hasn't. The genius gets all the treats and loves pulling toys out of it and dragging them off. She started at the advanced holes with no difficulty but I'm still trying to help the other special darling figure out the biggest, easiest hole. Either way, I'm entertained and the cats are entertained. It's a win/win. If your cat is easily baffled they're going to have a difficult time with this box.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mountain

customer_reviews.title: Made me laugh
customer_reviews.text: So I just dont know if it was my kitten or what! He could not figure this thing out - when we took out the cardboard in the middle he would only use it where he could stick his head all the way in the box or flip it over. He tied for over a month using high reward treats - nothing worked to get him to use it correctly. At least he got to use his brain and learned out to flip it over to collect his rewards (not the action we were looking for but hey he got his reward, we laughed and the dog got lucky enough to snag some cat food too)
customer_reviews.author: D Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Defective or something but possibly dangerous
customer_reviews.text: On,y giving 2 star because my 10lb cat ripped the cardboard when trying to get a treat out and her head got stuck in one of the openings. Based on reviews I am believing that I may have received a defective item; however I am not reordering because had I not been home she would have been like that for hours. I was going to only give one star but she really did like it.
customer_reviews.author: tigerlilly2255

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy/feeder, but...
customer_reviews.text: This box-maze works very well in giving my cat a challenge when getting dry cat pellets and treats. She has to work for her food. Also, with her occasional "barfing and scarfing" when she eats way too fast, this helps slow down some her pace of eating. The only negative I have is that the price may be a little high for something that's 100% cardboard. I understand they are recouping the costs of design, engineering and creation of dies for cutting, but come on...it's just cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Katsat

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining for cats and owners too!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat was putting on the pounds - well, one pound to be exact. But she’s pretty tiny so that adds up to a big weight gain. Vet said she needed to cut back on treats and get more exercise. This toy helps with both. We put two little treats in the box and watch her go nuts shoving the box all over the room while getting to those treats. It’s hilarious to watch, and she seems to really be enjoying it too. She’s kind of disappointed now if you DON’T put the treats in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Tytania891

customer_reviews.title: This is either too hard, or I have the laziest cat in the world.
customer_reviews.text: Not a Sturdy item. My cat didn’t like this at all. “This is too hard”, he said, and walked away. I took the baffles out, and he played with it for less than five minutes and said, “this isn’t worth it, it’s too hard, I quit!”. Not worth the price. I'm adding to my review a week later. I changed the overall rating to three stars. I still have the baffles out, but now he actually likes it and sits by it all the time looking at us expectantly.
customer_reviews.author: booklover

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy for Curious and Play Motivated Cats
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive toy for the right cat. My cats love solving puzzles and “finding” toys and treats I slip in a shoe or a pocket. They are all over this toy. It’s made of cardboard but it’s holding up to my giant Maine Coons sitting and laying on it. Also, a portion of all proceeds are used for kitten rescue. I would suggest not leaving it out all the time. This way, it’s an exciting new toy when it’s brought out again.
customer_reviews.author: KB Rye

customer_reviews.title: 5 minute toy
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. I was really excited and thought my cat would enjoy this but he gave up after 5 minutes and hasn't looked at it since.
customer_reviews.author: Erica B

customer_reviews.title: 15 dollars for cardboard box
customer_reviews.text: 15 dollars for a cardboard box. My cat ate into it. See pic. This is highway robbery. The only amazing thing about this box is the marketing tactics and the 5 star reviews The directions aren't accurate and not that great. It's a cardboard box with some holes. My cat turns it upside down and empties it.
customer_reviews.author: N. L. Coco

customer_reviews.title: Really works to stretch out feeding time. Super durable!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this toy is still intact after 9 months of taking a beating. I'm not sure our feisty manx kitty really gets the 'puzzle' part of it. She mostly just beats up the box until the treats fall out. It usually takes her at least 10 minutes to get them all out and she definitely gets a workout yanking and throwing the thing around our house. If she gets lucky and gets it to turn over that is the quickest way to pay day. Pretty entertaining for sure :)
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Clever Cat Toy
customer_reviews.text: Simple, but well thought out cat toy that will keep your cat amused and entertained. Very clever designations between easy and more difficult allows your cat to build up to more challenging levels, and also means your cat will keep coming back to this mystery box. Just show him a favorite toy or treat, then drop it in one of the cut-outs in the top of the box--he will poke and paw at it until he retrieves it... or give up until tomorrow. Especially good for kittens who need to expend energy at bedtime, when you would rather sleep!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: The depth of the box and size of the holes made it unusable for our kitty. Returned for credit
customer_reviews.text: This is a paper box! My expectations, from viewing the product and reading the company's description, was higher. This is a good concept. However, the holes in the box were of a size that once my kitty figured out how to gain access to her treat, was unable to slip her head out without toppling the box over. She was frightened. I continued to leave treats in and on top of the box. She did show interest a few days later. She, again, got her head stuck. When she raised her head the box moved with her until it was partially off the ground. This might work for a kitten. My kitty is 3 and a ragdoll.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy's mom

customer_reviews.title: Cat Toy Supreme
customer_reviews.text: My two kitties are bored during winter months so it's a hunt for toys they will play with, on there own. This box toy is fantastic for them! They circle it, paw it, try every opening with head and paws, spending several hours a day getting the goodies from inside. Funny thing is , they are not interested in eating the treats, they just love getting them out of the box. So we have kittie treats all over the carpet and two cats demanding more treats for their toy!
customer_reviews.author: Gail L. Crutcher

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan — cats find it too difficult
customer_reviews.text: My cats seem to find this too difficult to even really attempt. The problem is the puzzle itself is difficult to maneuver around, and it’s all cardboard which means the cats just push it around the floor since it’s so lightweight. Frustrating for the cats and for my wallet too. I would opt for a sturdy plastic puzzle feeder over something made out of cardboard. Oh it’s also overpriced ... because you’re literally paying for cardboard. Go to pets section in Marshall’s or TJ MAXXX and you’ll find cheaper and better cat toys.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: keeps my cat occupied
customer_reviews.text: Pros: easy to assemble; seems very durable. Actually keeps my cat trying to get the treats out! Cons: I wish the design could be improved a little bit. Sometimes the treats got pushed in between the "levels" - hiding under the ridges which makes it almost impossible for the cat to get them out. This happens quite often with the "intermediate level" area. For now I just put the treats carefully in the beginner and expert (not very hard for my cat) areas. Overall, great toy!
customer_reviews.author: Pallymore

customer_reviews.title: We now only use foraging toys like this (or the Mogoko Cat Catch
customer_reviews.text: Ordering my second, after 4 years of regular use. The old one stood up really well, just some minor stains (not food related) and decided to replace once the cardboard started to tear. We now only use foraging toys like this (or the Mogoko Cat Catch, or one of the balls that lets out a bit at a time) when supplementing our cats normal meals with dry food. This works with pretty much every type of dry cat food we have tried. We have two cats, one loves this, the other prefers the Mogoko but will use this one if it is the only source of food (perhaps he finds this one more difficult). Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: seaan

customer_reviews.title: Great idea - not durable
customer_reviews.text: Good idea. I’d upgrade the material to 275#B and hard top to the cutting die to reduce a lot of the crush from the ejection rubber around the cut outs. Suggest adding additional access hole for the cats on the other width panel. My cats enjoyed for a day and lost interest....yet to find something they like in all fairness. Gave to parents where cats love it, but falling apart quickly. Looks like the board might be ect (275 is Mullen with 69# liners) which has shorter fibers absorbing relative humidity like a sponge....product is on their enclosed porch -
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend for helping to keep kitty busy
customer_reviews.text: Superb toy! My cat loves this thing. We're getting ready to replace it because he has torn it apart. For the price, I only wish the cat couldn't rip it up with his teeth trying to get the treats, but I stuff the box with his toys making it even more challenging. Overall, highly recommend for helping to keep kitty busy. UPDATE: We purchased a new one even though they are much more pricey (not happy about that) partially because I read that kitties got their paws stuck in the the other wooden types. I've included a couple of photos so you can see how we stuff it with his smaller toys to make it more fun and challenging.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess of ur cat loves shredding boxes like mine does
customer_reviews.text: I always thought my cat was smart, so when I saw this product on Amazon I figured he’d solve all three levels in 5 min flat. Alas, that was not to be. He never solved even the beginner level. Instead of guiding the treats out of the maze, he decided to go at it with his teeth, ripping whatever parts of the box stood in his way. So now I just hve a pile of shredded cardboard and a cat that is either stupid or above solving paltry puzzles.
customer_reviews.author: Nita

customer_reviews.title: Engaging, intelligence-building cat toy!
customer_reviews.text: At first, my cat pointedly ignored her new toy. But the next day, when she thought I wasn’t watching, she ran over to it and began poking and reaching into it, getting down and peering into the doorways — it was so cute to watch! She had it all figured out; she even pushed and pulled and shook it around to move the treats into better positions. A great idea!! Important to use dry treats only, obviously. In our case freeze-dried salmon worked well because 1) the pieces are all different shapes and sizes, adding to the challenge, and 2) she’s very fond of them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Actually worth it
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was mad at myself for spending $16 on a cardboard box. However, my cat *loves* it. When you open the treat bag, he runs straight to the box. He would get e little frustrated at first, and ask for help. Now, he's a complete pro at clearing out the box. It also slows him down while eating treats. We give him a handful as we sit down for dinner, and it keeps him occupied while we eat. We've had it about two months, and it's holding up surprisingly well. Overall, it's been one of his favorite toys. Would buy again, though after this we might upgrade to the more challenging one.
customer_reviews.author: Weatherwise

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Cat Maze Treat Feeder.
customer_reviews.text: The arrived damaged. It also had the folds in the wrong places so it would not line enough correctly to stay fastened as needed. I looked at it to see if I could fix it rather than return it, but since it is only cardboard, it would have been easy for me to damage it further, so we decided to just return it. It definitely was not worth the money. We bought it as a suggestion by our Vet in order to have our cat have to hunt for his food to have him eat slower to help solve some digestive issues. There was no way to make this work since we could not make it stay together.
customer_reviews.author: johnjfost

customer_reviews.title: Highly intelligent cats will lose interest
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and Cat liked it for a couple weeks before the new wore off. My Cat is very intelligent, so it’s hard to keep his attention. He doesn’t play with laser lights either, he’s more interested in what’s in your hand. If your cat is very food motivated, it will like this toy and it’s fun to watch them contort their bodies to fish the treats out! I imagine this would be great for kittens and younger cats to help them burn off some energy.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy2bsure

customer_reviews.title: I would never spend money on this toy again
customer_reviews.text: The puzzle came in pieces. There were no instructions or picture to show how to put it together. it is made of heavy cardboard. After I finally figured out how to put it together, there was a piece left over. Food placed in the 'feeder' leaves grease spots. My cat can't get deep enough into the puzzle to get food left at the bottom. You charged way too much money for something that is absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Grey

customer_reviews.title: $15 for cat toy torture
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry but this is by far the worst I've ever bought for my cats. It's literally mean. I don't have carpeting so it slides all over the floor, they can't get anything out of it. And I thought it was worth about $2. Come to find out I paid $15 for this? I don't want to do any more returns but this is absolutely awful and the fact that I paid $15 makes me livid. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Loudacats

customer_reviews.title: Best cat toy ever created!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best cat toy every created. Cats love boxes, they love treats and playing is always fun and good for indoor kitties. I have had this for about 4 months and it is in great shape and my cat still loves it. I have learned I have to walk away from it after I put the treats in otherwise she thinks I will help her get it! I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: ItsSoFluffy13

customer_reviews.title: Cats really do love it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter assembled this for me telling me, Mum this is really good quality. No sooner had we put it on the floor and thrown some treats and toys in it than all 5 of my cats were at it. It was unbelievable. I wished it was longer because only 3 could really play at a time. It took some figuring which was good but eventually one got 2 treats and 1 got a toy. It keeps them thinking. It was a great buy for sure. Makes me laugh to watch them.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Goodbrod

customer_reviews.title: Fuzzy loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I had more difficulty putting it together than my cats did in using it. They sit beside it day and night after a session of hunting for treats. Purchased three “treat type toys”. This one the best and is used every day (they hope for twice daily). I put balls and a mouse in the box to increased difficulty, but my cat really has figured out how to reach in from the top and scoop out what he seeks to find. Our family members are enjoying the hunt too. Plan on purchasing for my grand kitties, too.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Arnold

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: I put several treats in it. First cat (2 years old) looked at it and tried for a few mins and never looked at it again, even tho his favorite treats are in it. Second cat, 9 months old, played with it trying to get the treats for several hours. Now it's a place to put his toy mice in after he is done playing with it. He puts the mouse in it, not me. But he doesn't get them out, he has me trained to get them out for him. Guess it's better in the box instead of under the refrigerator lol. Too bad he won't put his mice back into his toy box :(
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: Never had to work so hard for a treat
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this toy. I strongly recommend taping it to the floor so your cat doesn't just flip it around. We've had it for 5 months now and starting to show it's wear and tear plus he's been getting smarter about it. That said we've never seen him work so hard for a treat before. Plus since he's indoor cat he doesn't get to hunt and work on his motor skills otherwise, so this is a great substitute for otherwise spoiled lazy cats like him. 🤪
customer_reviews.author: kesslerIO

customer_reviews.title: Best money I’ve spent to entertain my cat yet
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for less than ten hours and my cat has already played with it for longer than all her other toys. I have other slow feeder puzzle toys but she’s got to the point where she empties them in minutes. This kept her entertained for a good long while. My only complaint is that I can’t wash it, so eventually kitty drool and crumbs are going to require a replacement — but it’s a replacement I’ll happily buy, especially since I can recycle the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Blair

customer_reviews.title: Provides fun and entertainment for your cats.
customer_reviews.text: This toy is providing lots of fun for my cats. I just put it together, added catnip, toys, and a few treats, and the cats were hooked. It's important for cats to be entertained if they can't go outside. They need stimulation and fun to stay happy. My cats beg for food when they are bored. I put some of their cat food in this toy to make them "work" for their meals. It has greatly improved their mood.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie A. Oyer

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: We've had it for about a week now, and my cat still enjoys fishing treats out of it. He's gotten considerably better at it, so last night I put a few treats in before turning the light off for the night. They were gone in the morning, but I'm not sure whether he was able to do it in the dark or just took care of things in the morning. The box is sturdy and feels secure. My cat loves to demolish cardboard boxes with his teeth and claws, but he hasn't done any dammage to this one. Can't wait for the tri-level "Epic" version to come out later!
customer_reviews.author: S. Harding

customer_reviews.title: Eventually your cat will get it
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that the cardboard wouldn't last long against my cat, but several weeks in and it is still intact! At first, my cat looked at the box with annoyance whenever I gave her treats into it, but now she anxiously awaits! I bought this puzzle to help keep my cat active. I have a treat dispensing ball, but began to notice her pushing the ball into corners to reduce the effort required. The box definitely presents more of a challenge that isn't as easily gamed as the treat ball.
customer_reviews.author: Prop Josh

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Our cats were very meh about this toy. They were curious about it the first time we put it out, but after that they sometimes wouldn't go after treats that were easily visible, never mind treats that were out of sight. Supposedly it gives them something to do during the day, but I'm not sure how much time they actually spend with the toy. It's OK, but certainly not "the best cat toy ever," that's a bold statement.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Carey

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. Cardboard doesn’t hold up!
customer_reviews.text: This should’ve been worth only five dollars because it basically is like one of the storage boxes that you get that you put together and I think those last longer than this did I only had it for a couple of weeks and my cats pulled it apart so now it’s worthless. So if you’re going to get a cat toy get something that’s made of plastic or metal or word because this isn’t it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 16-year-old blind cat who lives with me full time in my RV. It's a small travel trailer, so there aren't many places for her to go, and she gets bored. As soon as I saw this product, I couldn't wait to see if it would entertain her. Happily, it did. For longer sessions than I'm used to seeing her play, and over and over again. The only thing that would make this better would be if it were made of a stronger cardboard or chipboard, so it would be harder to crush it. I'd be willing to pay more for a sturdier version.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. Shafer

customer_reviews.title: The cat thinks it's the bee's knees
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this after seeing a friend post their new cat playing with it. Both of us (people) are introducing new cats into our households. It's a good distraction to keep our resident cat from messing with the new one. There are certain times of day that chasing occurs--just as or after we go to bed is one. We put this out with treats for the resident cat at that time and she's distracted and all is well. After all, sleep is what it's all about.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Flink

customer_reviews.title: Good company
customer_reviews.text: I liked the promptness of delivery. I liked the packaging - little waste. I like their program of donating toys to shelters. As for the product itself, it is really just cardboard. I think the price is high for what it is. My 6 month old kitten was interested in this for one day and has not really played with it since. I don't blame the company for this, cats are cats. The toy is creative, but overpriced. That's why I gave 4 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Bolen

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Puzzle Feeder
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my son & his GF who just adopted 2 beautiful naughty kitty brothers that are super charged with energy. The kitties love the puzzler & are still trying to figure it out on how to easily get the treats out. It keeps them occupied during this stay at home time. The box was easy to assemble, made of durable cardboard and has been played with numerous times by Gago and Momo.
customer_reviews.author: claychica

customer_reviews.title: This level is a bit easy
customer_reviews.text: We went backwards because the 3rd level is unavailable. My girl loves the second level, which has small boxes sliding around two levels of a bigger box. This one os fun too, but we want the 3rd most difficult level. Overall all three of these puzzles are fun for cats to hunt dry treats or food. The cardboard is sturdy & will last a long while if n to forever. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: May11

customer_reviews.title: This Truly is an Amazing Enriching Puzzle for Kitties
customer_reviews.text: This Cat Amazing product truly is amazing. As soon as I put some treats in the holes and recesses of this sturdy box my cat Zuni was captivated by the search for her treats. Enrichment for indoor kitties is so important and this gives them a way to hunt for their food. I am now reminded that it’s treat time every day and as soon as I get the Cat Amazing box out she jumps on it. The box is made of cardboard but very sturdy and lightweight and I love that they donate to rescue cats waiting for adoption and the box is recyclable in the end. Great company and great toy!
customer_reviews.author: netkat

customer_reviews.title: Interactive treat toy that works!
customer_reviews.text: It may seem like a simple toy, but my cats love this thing! I put some treats in there and it keeps them busy for at least 20 minutes! I’ll be ordering another one of these soon!
customer_reviews.author: Erin S.

customer_reviews.title: Any cardboard box will do
customer_reviews.text: I generally prefer not to review at all rather than give a bad one but I must speak on this item. If you put 2 small Amazon shipping boxes together your kitty/cat will enjoy as much if not more. This is simply as I described above with some holes.
customer_reviews.author: gigi

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a great play toy for my cat
customer_reviews.text: BUT, the insert does not fold according to the directions so we had to improvise. The picture shows the insert folded up at the end with the holes lining up, but if you fold it that way the end covers the open hole on the box. With that said, he loves it! Tons of fun. He even puts his other toys in it and tries to get them out. Seemed funny spending money on a cardboard box since I have plenty from amazon deliveries, but it was well worth it. If it was made better, with better directions it would have gotten 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Roadking2001

customer_reviews.title: IQ Test For Cats
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cat toy. I never thought I'd be buying educational toys for my kittens but this is the world we now live in. The first day I left it out there were quite a few treats still inside the toy and I dumped them out. But over a few days they figured it out and they never leave treats behind. It really is cool to see your cats figure it out and get rewarded for their efforts. It's also a great way to see which one of your cats is the smartest. I also think it's great because it gives your cat something to do while he waits for you to come home.
customer_reviews.author: Moons of Jupiter

customer_reviews.title: Victim of its own success
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my smart cat, thinking it might give him an outlet for his curiosity and playful energy. He loved it! But it only lasted 1-2 days before he got impatient and just ripped the face right off the box. There are still nooks and hidey holes inside, so he’s still having fun with it, but I don’t see it lasting the week. It’s a little too expensive to replace at that rate, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Well, it's good in theory!
customer_reviews.text: Good in theory, but if you have a cat who lives by "work smarter, not harder", well not so much haha. My kitty is chewing the box apart to get to the treats! Still a decent value. I put it up in the top of the closet when we're not playing with it so she won't chew it so much. Easy to put together and nice and sturdy. Great value if your cat doesn't eat cardboard ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Lilith Jezebel

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one
customer_reviews.text: It may seem crazy to spend $ on a cardboard box with holes in it, but my cat LOVES this thing. The first one was still working just fine after a couple yrs; but someone *ahem 😅* spilled coffee on it. Without hesitation, had a second one otw before I threw the first out. Highly recommend for treat motivated meows.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Popular right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: FIRST I wanted to say that the assembly video was super helpful. I opened the box and immediately got nervous, but the video made assembly a cinch. My cats are already really enthralled by it. They're a bit tough on cardboard so I expect this won't last forever, but that's okay given the price. Totally worth it to see them working together to get a treat!
customer_reviews.author: R. GilbertTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A toy that our picky cats actually spend a lot of time playing with
customer_reviews.text: Both of our younger cats are treat monsters and this toy was a perfect way to make them earn the treats instead of just giving it to them. One of the cats spends nearly an hour at a time extracting every treat while the other goes for the easy ones. Note that there are 3 levels of "hardness" to where you can put the treats. Start them out with a few on top and a few on the "easy" side.
customer_reviews.author: Markham T.

customer_reviews.title: 3 yr old loves it
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with my cats ability to get to these treats no matter what it takes! I have to leave her alone when I'm at work, & I dropped a bunch of treats into the different slots so she would not be bored. Well, I got home and ALL of the treats were gone. She is constantly sniffing it to see if there are more treats in there lol. I love that I can leave her to have some fun while I'm away. :)
customer_reviews.author: RN79

customer_reviews.title: An expensive piece of cardboard
customer_reviews.text: I wanted my little Leo to live this!!! I had some trouble putting the inside together to fit, I don’t understand how to make it hard/harder...it’s supposed to be adjustable...for me, it only fit one way. For me, it’s a really expensive piece of cardboard....I put Leo’s toys inside, with some treats, he didn’t want to “work” for his treats, playing with it about 3 minutes. Returned
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I do not have the most curious or playful cat. She doesn't like toys and couldn't bothered by ribbon. I set this toy up for her and let her knock the treats into the holes. She then walked away. I left it on my bed just in case. When I woke up in the morning there were only 2 treats left in it. I was so happy I almost cried. Thanks for such a wonderful and challenging toy for my cat. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: D. Silver

customer_reviews.title: I thought my cat was gifted
customer_reviews.text: But maybe not. The CatAmazing gets some of the day's playtime. When she discovered she can shove it down the stairs and reap a rich, lazy harvest of cat treats, I put some bells from walked-on cat toys in it. The treats seem more motivational.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and provides entertainment for bored cats
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when assembling this that it would withstand my cat's constant play it is cardboard after all. Well it just be some very speciy cardboard because my cat pouches on it, lays on it, she tries to stick her face in the holes and bite it and it still looks new and holds up great! She doesn't care for treats in it but when we put her favorite ball in there she goes wild trying to get it out! I'm so glad I bought this for her as she is just approaching a year old and was clearly bored. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Taysia B

customer_reviews.title: Cats favorite toy for two months now
customer_reviews.text: This is AWESOME. Lots of variety for kitty so she doesn't get tired of it. Easy to set up and move around. I can't emphasize enough how much my cat loves this toy. Sometimes she'll go over to scratch at it to let us know it's time to play again! Update: We've had this toy for about four months and our cat still plays with it. She's definitely better with it and can get the treats more quickly but hey, she earned them!
customer_reviews.author: MicroBio

customer_reviews.title: Keeps 'em busy.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little weird about spending 14 bucks on essentially a box, but i've gotta say, my cat loves it. I'll throw a handful of treats in there an she goes nuts trying to reach in and fish them all out. It is cardboard, so if your cat gets too desperate, there could be some bite marks and tears after a while. But it's hilarious to watch and makes them use their brain a little, so it's worth it. If this one get's too beat up, I might replace it with one of the bigger ones to mix things up.
customer_reviews.author: Lux (Cassandra)

customer_reviews.title: Can you teach an old cat new tricks???
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my young cat. He is just a year old and when he gets bored he picks in my older cats. He is very treat driven. So this should keep him occupied for a bit.....nope he is too lazy to even try, but my 14 yr old girl loves this box. I have to put it up at night because she scoots it all over the house. There might be just one more treat in there 😹
customer_reviews.author: Amethyst

customer_reviews.title: It's unfortunate
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful about this item since it was rated as one of the top cat toys. Unfortunately, my cat stopped trying on the third attempt. He retrieved a treat two times and on the third time, he barely tried to get it and walked away. The treat stayed in the box for a few days and he didn't even bother. It may work for some but not for my boy.
customer_reviews.author: martini

customer_reviews.title: Smart kitty loves it
customer_reviews.text: We have a very smart cat who is difficult to keep out of trouble. Her lil brain is always working. This puzzle worked great for a while. She figured out the hardest setting right away, so we started putting more challenging things in the box. A heavy copper ball, a cumpled bit of plastic, a fuzzy mouse toy. Things that didn't move so easily through the maze. That's when things got really interesting. She still figured it out, and the challenge was great for her. Thanks for making a challenging toy for our too-smart kitty!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Good for treats and toy mice
customer_reviews.text: Mika likes treats so we put a few in and she had fun getting them out. She also likes little toy mice. So I put one in with the tail showing through the hole and she pulled it out and then batted it around. We are not keeping it out all the time so she knows when it is out it means she will find some treats. She is hard on fishing pole toys but so far she just uses her paw to hunt for the treats and has not tried biting or sitting on it. Really glad we got one.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Ann Rose

customer_reviews.title: Rewarding Intellectual Stimulation for Cats
customer_reviews.text: This toy is FABULOUS! Our feline rulers love the challenge of solving puzzles and being rewarded with treats. Whoever thought of this is a genius who really "gets" cats. My only gripe is that it's pretty expensive for -- let's face it -- a souped up piece of cardboard. And it doesn't even come with treats! But nevermind, it's still worth it. This is a huge hit with our cats, and therefore worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Took a while to warm up but curious!
customer_reviews.text: Of the many products out there we can purchase to entertain our furry friends, this one was well worth the money. Our cat is curious and smells the treats but has only tried the easy side so far! Took him a few days to “warm up” to the toy. Initially, I thought this was going back or donated to someone else. Eventually, Bruce Wayne decided to explore.
customer_reviews.author: Avocado

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than the original
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first one about one year ago for my new kitten and it was great. We left it at our vacation home intending to buy a new one for the house. When the 2nd one arrived, it was about 25% smaller than the original and more suited to a kitten than a full grown cat. Loved the original, disappointed in the small size of the second one we purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky2000

customer_reviews.title: Cats weren't challenged
customer_reviews.text: I bought a similar product some time back and it seemed that the cats were engaged and challenged by it. This product just didn't seem to meet the challenge. It was also difficult to put together. I wasn't crazy about the slanted inserts. I do think it was less expensive than the earlier product -- and I don't really remember what the main difference was. This just wasn't my favorite. One of my cats liked it but the others lost interest.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Catfinder

customer_reviews.title: Easily portable food and enrichment experience
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for our newly adopted young adult calico cat, Sundae. Was hoping that if she had some extra things to bat around and play with, she might hassle the dogs a little less! She loves her Greenies treats, so I toss a few of those in the puzzle each day. Gives her something to do and she's rewarded with a treat she loves. I also sprinkled a little catnip on it to help keep her interest.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little toy mice and other small toys
customer_reviews.text: Skeptical at first and the cat wasn't interested at first when I put treats inside. I put his little ("Hartz Just for Cats") mice in the next day and suddenly he was so much more interested. I guess he just prefers his other puzzle toys where he has to pull a lever or slide something over to get the treat and for this, he likes hunting for his toys. It's probably better that way anyway because there does end up being space where treats might get caught between the cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: I have 2 cats ( a mom 1 yo & her kitten -boy 4mos) and they liked this at first but it got too difficult for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is ok. I have 2 cats ( a mom 1 yo & her kitten -boy 4mos) and they liked this at first but it got too difficult for them. However, I did give this 4 stars as the construction is good and the cats do have a good time with it in the beginning. It's definitely something you should wait to introduce when you are leaving to work. This way have something else to do instead of getting into mischief. This is definitely something that will come back around for my cats. I just need to fill it with some treats instead of kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Saira

customer_reviews.title: Incredible, Best Toy Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Here it is June 2017 and they STILL play with this! I just sprinkle hard kibble on it, they prefer to take it out of the holes lol. My CH handicapped kitty just loves this and I don't know why. He ignores all the other toys and I think he just likes the challenge! UPDATE, My new Siamese figured out how to flip the box over and get all the food out! He taught the others. Now I have it attached to a scrap board so they can't do that anymore.
customer_reviews.author: rhnevada

customer_reviews.title: They love it
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats. One is older and not very active but loves treats and immediately played with it for an hour. My other car is about a year old and while he was interested and curious he went nuts when I dropped three marbles inside the maze (he loves marbles) Now he plays with it all the time. Great gift. I recommend it for all cats.
customer_reviews.author: joyjoy

customer_reviews.title: Has my sick cat playing manically
customer_reviews.text: I have a 15-year-old cat who is very sick with either IBD or lymphoma. Took him to the vet this morning and we were talking about end-of-life decision-making. Got home and found this play box was delivered. I put it together and loaded it with a couple of his prescription treats and a few small toys (plastic jacks, pom-poms). He's been going wild playing with it for a good seven minutes so far.
customer_reviews.author: K. Minger

customer_reviews.title: Great cat toy!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cat toy and so does my little guy Mayhem. It didn't take him long to figure out how it works, but he still enjoys it. I put it out every morning with about four treats in it and let him go. I'm happy that it engages his brain and gets him thinking rather than just gobbling up treats. I'm definitely on the hunt to find more engaging toys now.
customer_reviews.author: C Wartman

customer_reviews.title: good puzzle for keeping my cat entertained
customer_reviews.text: My cat is about 2 years old (we think - he was a shelter cat), and has lots of energy to use. Since I work during the day, I wanted something to keep him entertained for a while each day, and this does the trick pretty well, Because it 'changes' his interest is kept up for a while. Great for a curious cat:-) The only down side is that it slides around on the floor; I'm thinking of adding a piece of non-skid mat to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: J Cat W

product_meta.title: Cat Amazing – Best Cat Toy Ever! Interactive Treat Maze & Puzzle Feeder for Cats
feature_bullets: INTERACTIVE CAT TOY – award-winning game & puzzle box – stimulates and occupies cats and kittens for hours – bonds cats and their owners through play!
ENCOURAGES NATURAL INSTINCTS to explore, scratch, sniff, find and retrieve hidden rewards – with three difficulty levels to challenge clever cats as their skills improve!
WORKS WITH your cat's favorite cat treats, catnip, crinkle balls, mice, cat wand toy and other favorites; works great as a dry cat food dispenser and puzzle feeder!
VETERINARIAN RECOMMENDED for exercise, slower eating, weight loss and meal management
ULTIMATE GIFT – holiday or everyday – for cats & cat owners!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
